translation: Hello, everyone!
transcript: 大家好!

translation: I am the artistic director of the TAO Dance Theater.
transcript: 我是陶身体剧场的艺术总监陶冶。

translation: It's April 29th today, the World Dance Day.
transcript: 今天是4月29号，是世界舞蹈日。

translation: So my speech today is very meaningful and suitable for this occasion.
transcript: 嗯所以此时此刻我站在这儿是非常具有一个意义的表达。

translation: First I'd like to thank Zaojiu Talk for giving me such an opportunity to share my views about dance.
transcript: 感谢“造就”这个平台给予我这样一个跟大家交流沟通关于舞蹈的一个机会。

translation: I am a dancer.
transcript: 我是一位舞者。

translation: So I may be much better at expressing my ideas with my body and movements.
transcript: 所以呢我可能更善于去用身体、肢体去表达我的内容。

translation: So please forgive me if I stumble over my speech or feel ill at ease.
transcript: 所以一会儿的讲话当中我可能会有点结巴，啊没那么的自在，所以请在座的各位呃就多多包涵。

translation: To make myself feel more relaxed and comfortable, I will sit on the ground for the rest of my speech and bring all of you to the world of dance.
transcript: 那接下来我就席地而坐啊，让我放松一点、自在一点，然后跟大家一点点地聊关于舞蹈的世界。

translation: The Tao Dance Theater is a full-time contemporary dance group.
transcript: 呃陶身体剧场呢是一个全职的现代舞团。

translation: It was co-founded by me, Duan Ni and Wang Hao in Beijing in 2008.
transcript: 是2008年由我、段妮和王好三个人从北京开始创办。

translation: And this year marks the 10th anniversary of the company.
transcript: 那至今为止我们已经成立了十年。

translation: During the past decade, we have performed at hundreds of art festivals in more than forty countries.
transcript: 呃十年的过程当中，我们去到了差不多四十多个国家，然后上百个艺术节进行演出交流。

translation: We have also developed a systematic set of body training and dance practice.
transcript: 呃也积累了自己关于身体训练，关于舞蹈练习的一整套的系统。

translation: That's what I'm going to talk about today: dance, body, and movement research.
transcript: 今天的主题就是这个，舞蹈、身体，呃还有运动和研究。

translation: It sounds like it doesn't have much to do with dance.
transcript: 听起来好像跟舞蹈关系不太大。

translation: Dance is a primitive form of art, so some people call it the mother of art.
transcript: 啊因为舞蹈作为一个原始的艺术，呃有人称它为呃艺术之母。

translation: That may be a little bit exaggerated.
transcript: 有点大哈。

translation: But my previous understanding of dance tells me it lives well up to that honor, because it involves the body.
transcript: 但是我认为我对舞蹈理解，它是完全配得上的，呃因为它用的是身体。

translation: From my perspective, dance is an art industry with no shortcuts.
transcript: 我对舞蹈的理解是，它是一个没有捷径的艺术行业。

translation: It draws on the body and its movements to communicate, accumulate and convey the purest message.
transcript: 呃它完全是通过朴质的身体力行来传达、来累积、来表达最纯粹的语汇。

translation: Well, the body is actually a concept in pan-art.
transcript: 呃身体其实是一个泛艺术的概念，呃。

translation: The body, combined with any carrier, will convey ideas.
transcript: 什么可能性的载体进入到身体当中都会产生表达。

translation: For example, the body can be a script, or a museum.
transcript: 比如说身体可以是一个剧本，或者身体是一个博物馆。

translation: The body is also the origin of our life, that is, the carrier of our life.
transcript: 当然身体也可以是最重要的是我们的本源，就是我们承载我们生命的载体。

translation: So dance with our body is the expression of time and also of vitality.
transcript: 那进入到身体当中进行舞蹈，也是时间的表达，然后也是生命力的表达。

translation: But the more important thing is the connection between dance and the body.
transcript: 对于舞蹈，对于身体这两两者之间，我觉得产生更重要的是连接。

translation: Dance connects me with the stage, and connects you and me.
transcript: 它连接这个现场，连接我和你。

translation: Every movement of the dancer communicates the vitality of life.
transcript: 在舞者的每一寸，每一瞬，他的表达当中都是一个生命力的绽开、绽放。

translation: Many of you may find contemporary dance hard to understand.
transcript: 关于身体，很多人就是说，看现代舞看不太懂。

translation: It is so abstract that you don't know what the dancers are trying to convey.
transcript: 啊然后很抽象，不知道他在表达什什么。

translation: To be honest, I feel equally puzzled when I watch some of the dances.
transcript: 呃老实说，我面对很多的舞蹈作品的时候我也看不懂。

translation: But I wouldn’t say I would try to "understand" what the dances want to express.
transcript: 但是我不会用“懂”来去呃试图接近于那些舞蹈作品。

translation: Because to me, dance is a vocabulary, not a language.
transcript: 因为舞蹈对我来说它是语汇，它不是一种语言。

translation: It contains both visual and auditory vocabulary.
transcript: 它是有很多的语汇，啊视觉语汇、听觉语汇。

translation: And the integration of the vocabularies on the scene forms an expression of vocabulary.
transcript: 整个现场感知的语汇交融在一起，汇聚在一起，它是一种语汇的表达。

translation: So when audience say "I don't understand your work".
transcript: 所以呢，我通常当观众问到我“你的作品我看不懂”的时候。

translation: I would normally responding by asking them to see the changes of light instead.
transcript: 然后我都会回答观众说，那你可以看光嘛，看光的变化。

translation: And the color of the costumes.
transcript: 然后你可以看服装的色彩。

translation: And the music.
transcript: 然后你可以听音乐。

translation: Or try to feel how the work brings you to a different field or just feel it, for your feeling is paramount.
transcript: 或者是感觉这个作品本身带给你的一个场域，你的感受，因为感受力是最重要的。

translation: If all this doesn't work and you are sleepy.
transcript: 实在不行，你昏昏欲睡，看不下去了。

translation: You can just grab some sleep, lying comfortably on the seat, and continue watching when you wake up.
transcript: 你就先睡一觉，啊然后舒舒服服地躺在观众席，醒过来，继续再观看下去。

translation: Well, this is how I usually communicate with my audience.
transcript: 啊我通常是这样跟观众在交流。

translation: Because I think it is the feelings that make it possible to build a space where people could communicate smoothly with each other.
transcript: 因为我认为，感受力才是人与人之间沟通当中没有界限的一个可一个空间可能。

translation: Whether you understand dance or not.
transcript: 呃对于懂和不懂来讲的话。

translation: What I want to share today is not only the beauty of dance and the power of the body, but more importantly, the reality of movements.
transcript: 我今天在场分享的不仅仅是关于舞蹈的美、身体的力量，更多的是关于运动的真实。

translation: Actually, movement research is a direction we have long been exploring.
transcript: 所以运动研究，是我们陶身体剧场一直在行进摸索的一个方向。

translation: One interesting thing about the body is that the flesh has limits, we have only two arms and two legs.
transcript: 其实我觉得身体很有意思的一点呢就是，我们都是两条胳膊，两条腿儿啊，是有限的一个肉身啊，清晰可见的。

translation: But in dancing, the movements of the body can be so diverse.
transcript: 但是随着我们的运动过程当中每个个体，借由舞蹈的探索可以展开那么多的千姿百态。

translation: This is fascinating!
transcript: 这对我来讲太神奇了。

translation: The movements can be totally different.
transcript: 它完全可以完全不一样。

translation: But even with the same movement or the same order, different dancers can create a different world.
transcript: 而同样的动作，同样的一个次序，但不同的舞者表达出来的却是不同的世界。

translation: So I feel the study of the body brings me back to the purest way of expression.
transcript: 所以我觉得身体的研究，就将我回归到最纯粹的表达。

translation: One area we have been exploring is the extent to which the plasticity, mobility, and physical limits of the body can be developed.
transcript: 身体的可塑性、能动性及身体的极限，它能开发、展开多少的可能性，这就是我们舞团一直在面向的一个方向。

translation: Well, now I'll move to the main topic today.
transcript: 嗯接下来我就进入到主题了。

translation: This is going to be very, very informative but it may seem different from the usual dance.
transcript: 啊也是今天的硬货啊，非常硬的硬货，也是呃看起来可能跟平常的舞蹈的一个表达不太一样的一种方式。

translation: But I want to try it today.
transcript: 呃我打算今天试一试。

translation: Let's get down to our business.
transcript: 进入到正题。

translation: Body, substance, space, gravity, throwing force and weight.
transcript: 身体、物质、空间、引力、抛力、重量。

translation: First, let us consider body as substance.
transcript: 首先我先讲一下身体作为物质。

translation: This may seem to be a self-evident topic to you, isn't it?
transcript: 那身体作为物质这个话题好像讲，其实大家一目了然，对不对？

translation: We are the product of the fusion of substances.
transcript: 我们是由物与物之间的融合造成的介质。

translation: The body is life itself, and it is also an origin of our life.
transcript: 啊这是生命体本身，也是承载我们生命本身的一个来源。

translation: Of course, life is a substance by which we can communicate with each other.
transcript: 生生命当然是物质，借由这个物质我们可以交流啊。

translation: There is another concept about dance that I wanted to mention previously but forgot to.
transcript: 因为对于舞蹈来讲还有一个观念我也想讲，呃前面忘讲了一点就是。

translation: For dancing, it is "I move, therefore I am."
transcript: 不是“我思故我在”。

translation: Rather than "I think, therefore I am".
transcript: 而是“我动故我在”。

translation: Sustances are expressed through movements whose existence is worth exploring.
transcript: 我在行动过程当中，有物质呈现表达的时候，这个存在本身我们是可以值得探讨的。

translation: The second point is about space and gravity.
transcript: 第二点 ，空间、引力。

translation: Well, we live in a world with gravity.
transcript: 我们身处在的这个环域，这个境境域是有引力作用的，啊。

translation: The world has a magnetic field and our body either confronts or reconciles with this magnetic field.
transcript: 它有个磁场让我们的身体跟这个磁场进行一个对抗，或者是和解。

translation: And the planet, and anything else is influenced by gravity.
transcript: 那整个星球地球是在，就万物是在这个引力当中起到作用。

translation: Including natural laws, the formation of four seasons, and many other physical effects.
transcript: 包括我们的规律，我们的四季，然后还有很多的物理作用。

translation: The throwing force is equal to the weight of the object being thrown.
transcript: 抛力等于重量。

translation: This means our movement is also a process of working against the gravity.
transcript: 就是代表我们的行动就是在发力过程。

translation: To make a vivid metaphor, the process is just like when you are throwing out an object.
transcript: 每一个发力过程，我有一个形象的比喻，就像你在拿一个物体在往外抛，往外扔。

translation: The distance the object travels and the force on it when it falls is in proportion to the force you exert.
transcript: 你用力量的多和少决定那个物体的远和近，你用的力量重一点轻一点，会决定它落下去的重和轻。

translation: Therefore, every movement we make is an act of throwing.
transcript: 所以我们身体运动的时候，每一个动作过程都在做抛力运动。

translation: Whether you're walking or squatting, you're making a transition of power, throwing youself out, and bringing yourself back the next moment.
transcript: 你的腿出去走路、蹲，都是一个力量之间的转换，你都在抛出去，下一刻再承接回来。

translation: Well, what I have shared so far seems like a physics class.
transcript: 好像听完以后整个我要表达的主题内容像是一堂物理课。

translation: Well, it is.
transcript: 没错，这就是一堂物理课。

translation: But this is going to be a very interesting physics class.
transcript: 但是一定是一场非常有意思的、有趣味的物理课。

translation: Now, I want to invite a dancer from our theater to come on stage.
transcript: 因为接下来我将有请舞团的一位舞者，然后一起上台。

translation: She will stand by my side and give a demonstration of how we communicate with the body.
transcript: 站在我的身边，跟大家进行演示关于身体的对话。

translation: Well, please welcome our dancer!
transcript: 来，有请舞团的舞者。

translation: I'd like to start with how we stand.
transcript: 我们先从“站”开始。

translation: The space we've just mentioned is consciously structured by our consciousness in the process of standing.
transcript: 刚才谈到的空间，由人站在这个定位的过程当中，已经被我们的训练意识结构而成。

translation: There's a lot of consciousness involved in our standing.
transcript: 我们的“站”有非常多的意识存在。

translation: Start with the support.
transcript: 首先是支撑。

translation: The soles support our ankles.
transcript: 脚底支撑着我们的脚腕。

translation: Our ankles support our knees.
transcript: 脚腕支撑着我们的膝盖。

translation: The knees support our hip bones.
transcript: 膝盖支撑我们的胯骨。

translation: The hip bones support our side ribs.
transcript: 胯骨支撑着我们的侧肋。

translation: Side ribs support our shoulders.
transcript: 侧侧肋支撑到我们的双肩。

translation: The cervical vertebra supports our head.
transcript: 颈椎支撑着我们的整个头部。

translation: All the way down from the head, the neck, the shoulder, the side rib, the hip, the knee, the ankles to the soles.
transcript: 由此由上至下，头、颈、肩、侧肋、胯、双膝、脚腕到脚底。

translation: This is the supporting mechanics of our body.
transcript: 这是支撑的一个本身的力学。

translation: But the body is not dead.
transcript: 但身体不是死物。

translation: It is animate.
transcript: 啊它是生命体。

translation: So the mechanics of the body are the most animate building, because it is changeable.
transcript: 所以身体的建筑反而是最灵动的建筑，它是可变化的。

translation: When we stand, we mentally divide the space into many parts.
transcript: 在站的过程当中我们把空间结构成很多部分，在我们的意识当中。

translation: First we may feel that there is a mirror in front of us.
transcript: 首先我们感觉它的前面，有一面镜子。

translation: A mirror behind us.
transcript: 后面有一面镜子。

translation: And a mirror on the left and the right.
transcript: 左边、右边各有一面镜子。

translation: A mirror over our head.
transcript: 头顶一面镜子。

translation: A mirror in the middle.
transcript: 中段一面镜子。

translation: A mirror on the ground.
transcript: 地面一面镜子。

translation: In the area where she is standing, she has mentally formed a space of countless points, lines and planes.
transcript: 她所在的这个区域，在她意识当中已经形成了无数的点、线、面结构而成的一个平方空间。

translation: The interesting thing is the oblique mirror.
transcript: 那有意思的是斜角的镜面。

translation: An oblique mirror in the front.
transcript: 前斜角一面镜子。

translation: An oblique mirror in the back.
transcript: 后斜角一面镜子。

translation: Oblique mirrors on the left and the right.
transcript: 左、右各斜角一面镜子。

translation: Her sense of space is broadened to more dimensions.
transcript: 她的空间就被多维化了。

translation: In this area, the mirror we face will undergo constant refractions.
transcript: 在这个点线面当中，你面对的镜像会不断地折射。

translation: From the front, to the back, the left, the right, the up, the down, and the center.
transcript: 前、后、左、右、上、下、中。

translation: Her shoulders are relaxed.
transcript: 她的双肩放松。

translation: Her back is stretched from the hair to the caudal vertebra.
transcript: 后背经过发丝到尾椎进行不断拉扯。

translation: She breathes in and out as she open her eyes.
transcript: 气息往下，呼吸随着她的目光打开。

translation: The ear and the shoulder blade are unfolded.
transcript: 耳朵、后背的肩胛骨展开。

translation: Every moment she stands, she communicates through her breath.
transcript: 在她每一刻站在呃过程当中，她的呼吸在进行沟通。

translation: This is her sense of time.
transcript: 这是她的时间感。

translation: She feels her body continually sinking down, heavier and deeper down towards the ground.
transcript: 她感觉她的身体，不断地往下陷，更重、更沉往地底下扎下去。

translation: The support itself helps her to feel the weight of standing.
transcript: 这是支撑的本身，让她有了站立的重量感。

translation: The standing position is a scientific posture discovered by the scientists who removed the flesh and muscles from the human body and found the ideal position.
transcript: 而站好的正步是由解剖学当中剔除掉人体的肉身、肌肉，然后只呈现骨头本身的一个科学科学姿态。

translation: Her heels are in the same vertical plane as the ischium.
transcript: 她的脚后跟正对着自己的坐骨。

translation: Her sides form two straight lines.
transcript: 外侧一条直线。

translation: She squats slightly and bends her knees, with the tip of the knee pointing to the direction of the middle finger.
transcript: 在双膝微蹲的时候，膝盖尖对着自己的中指往前方。

translation: So as to protect the meniscus.
transcript: 这样子不会伤害自己的半月板。

translation: In fact, when we move, it is less likely to hurt our body by squatting with our knees bending forwards than bending inwards.
transcript: 所以其实在运动过程当中，往正前方的蹲比往内更不容易挫伤自己的身体。

translation: Ok, let’s move to the side part.
transcript: 好，那我们到侧面。

translation: After the support, we'll talk about weightlessness.
transcript: 讲完支撑，我们现在讲一下失重。

translation: This is an interesting part.
transcript: 有意思的来了呵。

translation: Suppose a point supports all the weight and it suddenly goes out of balance.
transcript: 那当一个点在支撑所有的重量过程当中，如果那个点失去平衡。

translation: What kind of physical phenomenon will happen then?
transcript: 会发生怎样的一个物理现象？

translation: As you can see, her whole body will collapse and sink deep.
transcript: 大家可以看到，她的整个身体会崩塌，会往下，深陷下去。

translation: But there will be a linear clue, which goes all the way from the knee to the caudal vertebra to the top of the head, passed down one by one.
transcript: 但是会产生一条线索，一个线性的线索，由膝盖到胯到尾椎到头顶，一层一层一节一节地传递下去。

translation: What if the knees become weightless?
transcript: 如果是双膝呢？

translation: Do you notice that?
transcript: 大家看到了吗？

translation: The push I gave her leads to the collapse of the entire body, and the weight falls gradually to the ground.
transcript: 我给她的这个力量，导致整个身体的崩塌，重量一节节往下释放到地面。

translation: And what if the whole body experiences weightlessness and falls down straight like a chopstick?
transcript: 如果是整体的身体进行失重，像一根筷子一样硬邦邦的，进行直倒呢？

translation: She will draw on the inertia of the next moment to regain her balance.
transcript: 她要借助下一刻的惯性把自己的重心再重塑回来。

translation: What if she falls at an angle?
transcript: 如果是斜角的方向呢？

translation: You may think she hurts a lot when her falls, but this is not the case.
transcript: 大家看到摔下去好像很疼，但是并不然。

translation: As the body falls, the force is transmitted from one part to the other, forming a linear connection, and it is offset in the process.
transcript: 它的每一个过程都有一条线性连接，把所有的力量一节一节一节地传递下去而释放掉。

translation: This is the swith between support and gravity loss in the study of weightlessness.
transcript: 这就是我们在研究失重过程当中，支撑、失重进行的一个转换。

translation: The next thing is the rebound.
transcript: 下一个，反弹。

translation: What if the dancer draws on the push to pull herself back up?
transcript: 如果借力再还力呢？

translation: That is to come back with a force.
transcript: 借着一个力量再还回来。

translation: The body, just like a ball, is elastic.
transcript: 就像一个皮球一样它有弹性。

translation: When I throw it out, it falls on the ground and bounces back.
transcript: 我抛扔出去的时候，当它落地反弹回归过来。

translation: Then there's the inertia, the inertia of a force.
transcript: 它就会出现一个惯性，一个力量的惯性。

translation: Drawing on the inertia, the body pulls itself up.
transcript: 找到了一个惯性，往上一拔。

translation: It takes advantage of the inertia in the process.
transcript: 啊它是借势而起，啊整个过程。

translation: There's the inertia in the process.
transcript: 整个过程当中一定会形成一个惯性存在。

translation: Which is the continuous process of passing the force from one part to another.
transcript: 而惯性就是不断的过程进行连接循环。

translation: Just look how the inertia is produced by rebounding, connecting, and weightlessness.
transcript: 找一下，大家看一看一下啊，整个反弹、连接、失重怎么产生的惯性。

translation: It's done.
transcript: 完成。

translation: There's a lot of weightlessness in the process.
transcript: 整个过程当中它有非常多的失重产生。

translation: In the transformation from being supported to weightlessness.
transcript: 而在失重转换过程当中。

translation: She perceives the interaction between her body, the force and gravity.
transcript: 她一直在感知自己身体、力量、引力之间发生的一个作用。

translation: A daily routine in our rehearsal hall is to discover the mechanics potentials of our physical body.
transcript: 这是我们在舞团的排练厅里面每天在做的一件事情，就是发现身体作为物质本身的一个力学可能性。

translation: We connect our movements to form a circle.
transcript: 连接起来，最后回到圆。

translation: The circle forms a non-stop cycle, a connection of the support, the weightlessness, the rebound, and the inertia.
transcript: 圆是一个循环，不断地循环，将刚才的支撑、失重、反弹、惯性到连接不断地返回进行一个重抒重塑。

translation: This is an endless process of remodeling and transforming.
transcript: 它是一个无始无终的梳理过程。

translation: Let’s look at the entire process.
transcript: 来，大家看一下整个过程。

translation: She stands on the ground, pull up, falls to the ground, hangs in the air, and bounces back, and after many connections she forms a circle.
transcript: 站立到地面，拎、放、挂、空中、反传，有很多传接过程到最后圆。

translation: Well, she can keep dancing, as long as she has the strength.
transcript: 啊她可以一直跳下去，只要她的体力无限。

translation: She can keep looking for the inertia and her sense of coordination, she keeps sensing the space with her body.
transcript: 她可以一直一直不断去找身体惯性、协调性、空间感。

translation: She dances into one circle after another.
transcript: 她变成一个圆，一个圆，再一个圆。

translation: And this brings us to a more difficult movement associated with lying.
transcript: 然后接下来我们要把这个话题，延伸到一个更困难的一个角度，“躺”。

translation: Ok, let's talk about lying now.
transcript: 啊现在我们来讲一下“躺”。

translation: While standing puts the pressure on the feet.
transcript: 脚的重量变得更加多了，站立只是双脚的支撑。

translation: Lying draws on the support of the whole body.
transcript: 但躺是全身整体的支撑。

translation: Her shoulders, elbows, and hands are here to support the head, and her entire body spreads out like a piece of paper on the ground.
transcript: 肩、肘、手的支撑到头，她的整个身体像一张纸一样平铺开，放到地面。

translation: Every torso, joint, hip bone, side rib, and the spine, the head, and even her fingers can feel the weight of her entire body.
transcript: 每一个躯干、关节、胯骨、侧肋、脊椎、头部，甚至到你的手指头，她的重量都要能感受得到。

translation: As she breathes, she will consciously move the weight to the lower part of her body.
transcript: 随着她的呼吸，她每一次往下传递的意识就会变更重。

translation: And feel the weight exerted on the torso of the body and the ground.
transcript: 她就要来感受身体的不同躯干跟地面产生的这个重量关系。

translation: So once the body touches the ground, the space will become more diverse.
transcript: 所以一旦到了地面，所有的空间会变得更加的多元。

translation: It's the support of the entire body.
transcript: 这是全身的支撑。

translation: If the body is supported by four points, the support will be rather stable in the process.
transcript: 如果是四个点的支撑，四个点的支撑在整个过程当中也会比较稳定。

translation: What if it is supported by three points?
transcript: 如果是三个角的支撑呢？

translation: To keep the balance on the ground, there must be at least three force bearing points.
transcript: 三个角的支撑是一个极限，在地面，比较有平衡。

translation: The body will lose gravity if there are only two points.
transcript: 如果两个点，就会失重。

translation: In that case, there will be a rebound.
transcript: 那在两个点的一个失重过程当中，出现的下一个反弹。

translation: The body rebounds, and falls to the ground.
transcript: 反弹，放，到地面。

translation: And with the inertia of the rebound, it falls to the ground, and rebounds again.
transcript: 顺着反弹的惯性再抛起，落到地面，反弹。

translation: All her strength is controlled by an invisible line.
transcript: 她所有的力量都是之间有一条线性敞开。

translation: Standing back on the ground is more a result of the rebound.
transcript: 而站立到地面更多的是一个回归的作用。

translation: But lying on the ground keeps your body closer to the ground and the magnetic field itself.
transcript: 让自己的身体更靠近于这个地面本身，更靠近于这个磁场本身。

translation: And makes the support points more diverse.
transcript: 让自己所有的支撑点维度变得更加的多元。

translation: It is three-dimensional, and though constantly repetition, becomes four-dimensional.
transcript: 它甚至是一个立体的三维，不断地进行三维的叠加，而形成四维。

translation: This way, we can feel every moment and every body part.
transcript: 不断地微观每一刻，每一个躯干，每一个自己的微观部分。

translation: Let's return to the topic of ground.
transcript: 我们再回到地面。

translation: Let's take a look at the coherent movements on the ground.
transcript: 大家看一下，整个连贯动作地面的。

translation: Draw a circle, repeat the cycle, experience weightlessness, fall and rebound, and pull herself to stand, and fall to the ground.
transcript: 画圆、循环、失重、放、反弹，最后结束回到站立，由站到地面。

translation: The last thing I want to talk about is spinning.
transcript: 最后我想讲的是，转。

translation: We can see the previous movement involves a lot of spin which is one of the most valuable movements.
transcript: 大家跟可以看到它有非常多旋转的部分，而旋转是最有价值的。

translation: In the training of our early works.
transcript: 在我们早期的作品训练当中。

translation: We found through our study on walking and on center of gravity, that there involves the turning in the process.
transcript: 我们通过走，重心的转换，我们发现所有的过程当中都有一个转动过程。

translation: Our ankles, heels, soles, and toes all move in a circle on the ground and keeping turning.
transcript: 我们的脚腕、脚后跟、脚掌、脚趾头都在跟地面发生一个圆，不断旋转的关系。

translation: And turning seems to be the ultimate and the most mysterious secret of all living things.
transcript: 而“转”好像意味着所有生命体最终极、最神秘的奥妙。

translation: The flowers also spin, the world spins and our thoughts are spinning between us.
transcript: 花儿也在旋转，世界也在旋转，我们相互之间，我们的思想也在旋转。

translation: Just like a whirlpool, the turning produces energy and brings us together.
transcript: 旋转好像就像一个漩涡一样，它产生能量，让我们相互交融，融合在一起。

translation: You can enjoy a whole set of turning by our dancer.
transcript: 接下来有一整段关于旋转的一套语汇，大家可以观看一下。

translation: And in the process, we can perceive the relationship between the multidimensional space, the internal vision, external vision, and suspension.
transcript: 在整个观看过程当中，可以感视到就是关于多维的空间内视与外视和悬挂的关系。

translation: Ok, it’s finished.
transcript: 好，结束。

translation: Excellent!
transcript: 非常好。

translation: Ok, my sincere thanks to the dancer.
transcript: 好，感谢舞者。

translation: The performance brings us to the topic of internal vision, external vision, and multidimensional space.
transcript: 呵刚刚整个的过程当中，我要谈到内视与外视、多维空间。

translation: We have a term called the "Golden Eyes".
transcript: 我们有一个词叫“黄金眼”。

translation: That is, when the dancer turns, he or she can't see anything but glittering flashes like on a roller coaster.
transcript: 就是你在转动过程当中，你的眼像过山车一样捕捉不到很多很多空间的视线，金光闪闪一片。

translation: So the dancer must be very clear about her standpoint during her turning.
transcript: 所以她在转动过程当中，她要非常清楚她的立点。

translation: And about the point she need to focus on next.
transcript: 下一刻要捕捉的受重点是在哪儿。

translation: All this must be determined when the dancer turns to the right or to left, or forward.
transcript: 通过旋转，往右，往左，还是往前，就这个整个过程当中所要发生，在她的意识当中要形成。

translation: As she turns and loses balance, her body is like in a space in universe, without support and hanging.
transcript: 旋转、失衡，她的身体就像是在一个宇宙的空间当中，没有支撑，悬挂在一起。

translation: And all the space will become her center of gravity.
transcript: 所有的空间都会变成她的着力点。

translation: So this is the process of forming a circle from the spins which we have been looking for.
transcript: 这是我们一直在寻找关于“转”而导致到“圆”一个循环的过程。

translation: This requires the dancer's body to be fully developed.
transcript: 这对舞者的身体的开发有极致的一个苛刻要求。

translation: The dancer has to go through constant training and practice to find a linearity of imbalance, inertia, connection, transformation and rebound.
transcript: 就不断地训练，找到失衡、惯性、承接、再转换，反弹回来的一个线性。

translation: And the practice of turning helps to develop the "circular movement system".
transcript: 然后在整个过程当中，我们由于“转”找到了“圆”运动体系。

translation: This marks one stage of our ten-year development.
transcript: 这是我们舞团十年的一个阶段。

translation: The circle means the source of life and our body itself.
transcript: 圆在这个地方，它意味着是我们的源头及我们的身体本身。

translation: It’s also the starting point.
transcript: 它也是一个原有。

translation: That is, every movement you make will motive you to throw a question.
transcript: 就是你的每一个动作出去以后，你会抛出一个问题。

translation: What's next if I make this move?
transcript: 我一个动作出去以后?

translation: This is a question.
transcript: 这是抛问。

translation: And next how can I answer the question?
transcript: 下一刻，我怎么样子去解答这个动作的问题。

translation: It is answering the question.
transcript: 它在解惑。

translation: So this is a constant process of asking questions and providing answers.
transcript: 所以不断地进行问题的来回交替。

translation: Find an answer, and throw a question, and then find an answer before moving to the next question. It is a cycle.
transcript: 回答，再提出，再回答，再提出，产生一个循环。

translation: And how do you move in this cycle?
transcript: 而在这个循环当中怎么动？

translation: Why moving?
transcript: 为什么动？

translation: How we move is a process in which meanings are produced and it requires a lot of thinking.
transcript: 在动的过程当中产生的意义，就像一个思辨的过程一样。

translation: We integrate our imagination, consciousness, rational thinking with our body.
transcript: 借由想象、意识、理性的思维和身体之间的一个力行产生融合。

translation: In the development of the circular movement.
transcript: 在圆的过程当中。

translation: I remember that a very famous architect called Gaudi said that "The curve lines belong to God".
transcript: 我记得有一位非常有名的建筑设计师叫高迪说过，曲线是属于上帝的创造。

translation: Let's get down to our business.
transcript: 回归到这个话题。

translation: Our bodies are full of curves, and our lives are full of curves.
transcript: 我们的身体充满曲线，我们的生命充满曲曲线。

translation: Our foreheads, ears, chins, noses, lips, and every inch of our body, are all curved, and they all flow.
transcript: 我们的额头，我们的耳朵，我们的下巴，我们的鼻尖，我们的嘴唇，我们身体的每一寸，都是有弧线的，它都在流动。

translation: The curves form a kind of cycle.
transcript: 圆就是一种循环。

translation: Every inch of the body can be connected.
transcript: 身体的每一寸都可以连接在一起。

translation: And in that process, even your hair is cylinder-like.
transcript: 在连接的过程当中，甚至连你的毛发、头发丝儿都是圆柱形的。

translation: And the flowing process creates an eternal movement, the flow of consciousness.
transcript: 而在流淌的过程当中造成一个永恒的运动，意识的流动。

translation: It is important to "draw circles with imaginary pens"  when the dancer dances in circles.
transcript: 在我们的圆运动当中，有四个字是非常重要的，叫“生笔画圆”。

translation: Oh, let's have a quick interaction.
transcript: 呃那我来做一个小互动。

translation: Just remain seated and try to communicate with me through your head and shoulders.
transcript: 现场观众不用站起来了，那就用你们的头部、肩部，呃简单地跟我进行一个沟通。

translation: Imagine we have a pen mounted on top of our head.
transcript: 我们想象我们的头顶长出一支笔。

translation: Just close your eyes and listen to me.
transcript: 你可以闭上眼睛想象，听到我的语言就好。

translation: You can now try to draw a circle with the tip of the pen.
transcript: 用这个笔的笔尖然后进行一个圆圈的运动。

translation: It doesn't have to be a complete circle.
transcript: 这个圆不一定是一个完整的圆。

translation: It can be an irregular one.
transcript: 它可以是不规则的线。

translation: After that, we can slowly switch to the left earlobe.
transcript: 到圆的过程当中，慢慢我们转换到我们左边的耳垂。

translation: With the earlobe, we can draw the circle clock-wise and counterclockwise.
transcript: 我们可以画圈的过程当中，正圆、顺圆、逆圆、平圆。

translation: Then you can try to draw circles with you right shoulder, your armpits, elbows, wrists, or your ring finger.
transcript: 到我们的右肩，肩、腋下、肘、手腕、无名指。

translation: All your body parts can be a pen.
transcript: 你的身体不同的点可以产生那支笔。

translation: It can be your nose or lips.
transcript: 它可以是你的鼻尖、嘴唇。

translation: It can also be your collarbone, side ribs, or your tailbone, knees, and even your toes.
transcript: 可以是你的锁骨、侧肋，也可以跑到你的尾椎、膝盖，甚至是你的脚趾头。

translation: So far, I can draw circles with four invisible pens.
transcript: 所以在画圆的过程当中，我至今能做到的，产生意识有四支笔产生。

translation: I have the four invisible pens which grow out of my body and draw different circles.
transcript: 我同时可以有四支笔，在我的身体内部生长出来，然后进行不同的画圆。

translation: Elbows and back of the ear with the toes and wrists, or with the back of the head and knees.
transcript: 胳膊肘、耳背，同时脚趾头、手腕，同时后脑勺、 膝盖。

translation: Isn't it interesting?
transcript: 有意思吧？

translation: There are endless combinations that expand your scope of imagination.
transcript: 无穷无尽，无穷无尽地你可以延展出想象的空间。

translation: This imagination can help you develop your consciousness and body.
transcript: 通过这个想象，你开发你的意识、身体。

translation: Every time the movements are different but you can still store some of them in the memory.
transcript: 每一次的动作都不一样，你都能储存一部分的记忆。

translation: And then you try to look for the lost part, think about it, and then transform it by creating an infinite circle.
transcript: 然后再去寻找，再去思辨，再去转换，无穷无尽地循环。

translation: The infinite circle.
transcript: 圆的无限流。

translation: That infinity comes from the support of our spine.
transcript: 无限性在于我们身体有一根脊椎的支撑。

translation: The spine is our axis and it allows us to stand and walk.
transcript: 脊椎是我们的轴心，因为脊椎我们可以站立，可以行走。

translation: What’s more, it seems to bestow dignity on us and equips us with the ability to look far away and support ourselves.
transcript: 因为脊椎好像我们有了尊严，啊我们可以远视，我们可以支撑。

translation: But the spine can be further developed in our movements.
transcript: 但是脊椎的作用在我的运动当中，它能得到更多空间的开发。

translation: Because we have a limited vision and listening ability.
transcript: 因为我们身体的视野是有限的，听力是有限的。

translation: We stand facing a flat world.
transcript: 我面向一个平面的世界。

translation: But with the spinning, twisting, folding, opening and closing of our spine, the space of our body can be developed and twisted.
transcript: 借由脊椎的旋、拧、折叠、开、关，你的身体的空间可以发现、扭曲。

translation: And our vision is broadened as our body can be folded and turned.
transcript: 你所有的身体的过程当中都可以进行折叠、旋，然后你的视野被拓展了。

translation: The spine also gives a spatial sense to our hands, feet and hips.
transcript: 脊椎也会让你的手变得更有空间感，脚变得更有空间感，胯变得更有空间感。

translation: The connection of the spine allows us to produce endless movements across all points, lines, and planes of our body.
transcript: 你所有的点、线 、面，借由脊椎的连接产生永无止境的波动。

translation: Like an electrocardiogram, every part of your body can bend in powerful waves.
transcript: 像一个心电图一样，你身体每一寸都可以进行波浪，哈。

translation: It is a romantic but hard to do it.
transcript: 很浪漫哈，但是很难，很难。

translation: You have to connect every part of your body.
transcript: 你要把你身体的每一寸连接下去。

translation: Even with the ground, and even to the point of your entire body is turning on the ground.
transcript: 甚至到地面，甚至整个人在地面旋转起来。

translation: The essence of our circular movement system that we've being exploring is the peaceful co-existence of all things.
transcript: 万物共在，这是我们圆运动体系一直在寻找到的一个本质。

translation: We have the seven senses: eyes, ears, mouth, nose, body, mind, time.
transcript: 眼、耳、口、鼻、身、意、时，七感。

translation: These represent our physical world and our spiritual world.
transcript: 七种感受代表了我们的物理现象和我们的精神世界。

translation: We have the ability to see, hear, and smell.
transcript: 我们可以看见、听见、嗅到。

translation: From the linguistic expression, breathing, physical touch, to the establishment of our consciousness, imagination, and thinking.
transcript: 语言的表达、呼吸、身体的触碰、触感到我们的意识的建立、想象、思辨。

translation: Our body finally becomes the time itself and time becomes the expression of the body.
transcript: 最后你的身体变成时间本身，时间成为身体的表达。

translation: Since all things co-exist peacefully, I can see you and you can see me.
transcript: 万物共在，我看见了你们，你们看见了我。

translation: You can hear my voice and I can feel your breath.
transcript: 你听到我的声音，我能感知到你的呼吸。

translation: Dance connects all this together.
transcript: 所有的一切，舞蹈连接在一起。

translation: Dance becomes a form of connection that allows dancers to observe themselves and connect with the world.
transcript: 舞蹈就变成一个连接的艺术，观察自我，连接这个世界。

translation: So next, let's welcome our dancer Huang Li back to our stage.
transcript: 那接下来有请舞者黄丽再次上场。

translation: She will perform a dance in a circular way.
transcript: 然后呢在整个过程当中。

translation: Starting from spinning, then performing on the ground and standing up.
transcript: 她会借由旋转、地面到站立完成一段关于圆运动的一段舞蹈。

translation: Music.
transcript: 音乐。

translation: Huang Li is an excellent dancer in our theater and we have worked together for three years.
transcript: 黄丽是我们舞团来了三年的舞者，非常的优秀。

translation: She also performs in one of the videos I just showed.
transcript: 也是刚才大家看到开始的视频当中其中的一员。

translation: Well, her body is not a typical woman's body, rolling over, and seems very androgynous.
transcript: 呃这完全不像是一个女性的身体，翻来滚去，非常的中性。

translation: We don't distinguish between women and men in our theater.
transcript: 所以在舞团里面没有女性和男性这样子的差别。

translation: In fact, androgyny is the most powerful characteristic.
transcript: 而中性是最强大的。

translation: Being androgynous means that one can be both powerful and soft.
transcript: 雌雄同体，你也可以非常的有力量，也可以非常的柔软。

translation: This is the plasticity of the body.
transcript: 这就是身体的可塑性。

translation: A brief moment is eternal.
transcript: 瞬间即永恒。

translation: Dance is the art of pity.
transcript: 舞蹈就是这么一个艺术，遗憾的艺术。

translation: Every moment is about to slip sway and can never be recovered, leaving endless pities and regrets.
transcript: 每一瞬间即将逝去，而逝去的这一瞬间再也不会挽回，留下无穷无尽的遗憾。

translation: So I have been telling dancers not to be obsessed with the moment on stage.
transcript: 所以我一直在告诫舞者不要迷恋在舞台上的那一刻表达。

translation: On stage, they are overwhelmed by your attention and applause.
transcript: 因为你们的关注，你们的掌声会塞满给他。

translation: But when the curtain falls, they retreat into loneliness and endless emptiness.
transcript: 当大幕落下，又变成一个孤独的个体，会抽离掉，变成空洞。

translation: So we have to feel the concentration at every moment, the connection between us, and the relationship between us and the world.
transcript: 所以要感受每一刻的专注，要感受每一个人与人之间的连接，要感觉自己与这个世界的关系。

translation: No matter where we perform on stage, we're not alone.
transcript: 你在舞台上，前后左右你在哪儿，不是你一个人。

translation: All coexists.
transcript: 是所有东西共在。

translation: We will be filled with the consciousness of co-existence.
transcript: 而共在的意识也会塞满你的意识。

translation: The integration of different kinds of consciousness becomes a momentary integrity.
transcript: 意识和意识之间产生交融，成为一个瞬间的完整。

translation: And this integrity gradually grows to be eternal, a disappearing eternity.
transcript: 当这个瞬间的完整不断累积的过程当中形成永恒，一个逝去的永恒。

translation: The momentary body movements are the sculpture of the moment.
transcript: 流逝的身体，瞬间的雕刻。

translation: In the process.
transcript: 在流逝的过程当中。

translation: Our life is the superficial representation, and it cannot be recovered, so it is finite.
transcript: 我们的生命，这就是本象，不会回返，这是有限的。

translation: But our life is also infinite in the sense that we will bring back that lost moment at next moment.
transcript: 但我们的无限是我们会继续通过下一刻，再把那一刻找回来。

translation: It proliferates as it slips away.
transcript: 它是不断不断在流逝当中繁衍下去。

translation: Our energy, our thinking and our possibilities of movements are infinite.
transcript: 你身体的能量的无限，你的思索的无限，你行动可能性的无限。

translation: Every moment of movement becomes part of your body, and a sculpture.
transcript: 每一刻的雕刻都变成你的身体，成为一个雕像，一个雕塑。

translation: It is a sculpture of the process.
transcript: 它是过程的雕塑。

translation: Each moment can be a photo.
transcript: 每一刻都可以形成一张照片。

translation: And each process or each movement will become a texture.
transcript: 每一个过程，每一个动作都会变成一种质地。

translation: In making the sculpture, the time unfolds itself.
transcript: 而在雕刻的过程当中，时间展开了。

translation: And our body becomes the materialization and a measure of time.
transcript: 我们的身体变成时间的物化，变成时间的一个度量。

translation: Our body represents time.
transcript: 我们的身体就代表着时间。

translation: We have different speeds in breaths, heartbeats, and stomach squirming, but that's the magic of nature.
transcript: 虽然我们的身体呼吸的时间不一样，心跳的时间不一样，我们的胃蠕动的时间不一样，但是大自然就是很神奇。

translation: It ensures a balance of time in the body.
transcript: 让所有的时间平衡在身体的这么一个躯干当中。

translation: The degree and speed of our movement are an expression of time.
transcript: 这个容器当中你的动作长与短，快与慢都是在表达时间。

translation: And time is not confined to the clock we see.
transcript: 而时间它不是我们看到的钟表。

translation: It is much more flexible.
transcript: 它是有弹性的。

translation: Because each living body has its own sense of time.
transcript: 因为每一个生命体有自己的时间感。

translation: And the process of time becomes a complete expression.
transcript: 在时间的一个过程当中，过程成为一个完整的表述。

translation: Because dance is not a point, a line or a plane.
transcript: 因为舞蹈不是点、线、面。

translation: It is an ongoing and non-stop process.
transcript: 它是一个过程，它不会停止。

translation: As long as you're still alive and the world still exists, your breathing will still be there, and the whole process is the expression of time.
transcript: 只要你的生命还在，此时此刻这个现场还存在，你的呼吸还在，整个过程本身就是表达。

translation: So I often stress that the expression of dance should not focus on a certain moment.
transcript: 所以我一直在强调，舞蹈的表达不要去专注于某一瞬间。

translation: But on the connection, or the process.
transcript: 而是连接部分，这个连接的部分就是过程。

translation: In our years of exploration.
transcript: 我们在长年累月的一个摸索当中。

translation: I come to feel the ultimate power of passing the baton of dancing to future generations.
transcript: 我慢慢感受到了一个非常终极的力量给到我，就是薪火相传。

translation: I want to share a little story.
transcript: 这我要讲一个小小的故事。

translation: The Tao Theater was co-founded by me, Duan Ni, and Wang Hao.
transcript: 就是这个舞团是由我、段妮、王好来创立。

translation: At the initial stage, only three of us struggled to perform our work on stage.
transcript: 早些年的时候呢，只有我们三个舞者在舞台上拼搏，表达作品。

translation: But as we become older and our body grows weak.
transcript: 那随着时间的累积，然后我们身体的衰弱。

translation: We are gradually drifting away from the stage.
transcript: 我们离舞台也渐行渐远。

translation: So whenever we see dancers still expressing themselves purely, clearly and attentively on the stage.
transcript: 所以每当我看见那些舞者还在舞台上自我地、纯粹地、努力地、专注地表达时候。

translation: The three of us will be moved to tears.
transcript: 我、段妮、王好都会热泪盈眶，非常感动。

translation: Because I feel these emerging artists have played an increasingly important part in performing dance on stage.
transcript: 因为我感觉到他们接替了很重要一部分的力量在舞台上。

translation: It is a kind of spirit, an emotion, a resonance of our spiritual world.
transcript: 是一种精神，是一种情感，是我们精神世界的一种共鸣。

translation: This is a continuation.
transcript: 这就是延续。

translation: And dance is not about individuals.
transcript: 而舞蹈不是个体，它不是个体。

translation: It is about the relationship between people.
transcript: 舞蹈是人与人。

translation: It is about people and life.
transcript: 人与生命。

translation: Because rather than rendering people lonely, dance connects the whole world together.
transcript: 因为舞蹈让人不孤独，它让世界的万物连接在一起，让人感觉到人。

translation: Making people feel the connection with other people, and it allows people to integrate with nature through observations.
transcript: 让人在人性的观察当中融入到这个世界，这个自然。

translation: Loneliness may be the ultimate fear of human beings.
transcript: 孤独可能是我们人最终极的一种恐惧。

translation: We fear loneliness just as we fear death.
transcript: 我们害怕孤独，就跟我们害怕死亡一样。

translation: It seems that after death, we will have nothing but the word "lonely".
transcript: 似乎死亡后的世界我们将一无所有，只留下“孤独”两个字。

translation: Dancers incorporate dance into part of their daily life.
transcript: 而舞者、舞蹈就是相处在一起。

translation: They strike a chord with other dancers or people by watching and imitating their dances and by dancing to retain the moment.
transcript: 天天通过观看、模仿、雕刻那个时间，让人的情感累积在一起成为共鸣。

translation: Our next plan is a nomadic plan that grows out of our long-term performance tour.
transcript: 这是我们接下来的计划，也是在长期的巡演当中一点点地延伸出来的游牧计划。

translation: This plan follows the lifestyle of the nomads.
transcript: 游牧就像游牧民族一样。

translation: We bring dances and perform them in different cities and spaces in China.
transcript: 我们带着我们的舞蹈、身体去到中国的各个城市，不同的空间。

translation: It doesn't have to be a theater.
transcript: 不一定是剧场。

translation: It could be a school or any public space.
transcript: 它可以是学校，它也可以是任何的公共空间。

translation: Such as the art gallery, as long as we can communicate like this on the scene.
transcript: 美术馆，让人与人像此刻一样直面于现场。

translation: We can see the sweat, and feel the breath.
transcript: 我们能看得见汗水，我们能感受到呼吸。

translation: We can see or hear it in its most original form.
transcript: 看见、听见还原它的原始性。

translation: And let people connect with each other on the spot.
transcript: 让人与人之间在现场当中连接起来。

translation: And the connection itself is the benefit of dance.
transcript: 而这个连接本身也是舞蹈的作用。

translation: It can connect the world.
transcript: 它可以连接世界。

translation: It can also relieve people's loneliness on the spot.
transcript: 它还可以让人与人之间通过这个现场不孤独。

translation: And then in different scenes, inspire communication between people.
transcript: 然后在不同的现场当中，人与人产生启发、交流。

translation: Dance is more about retaining the moment than experiencing it.
transcript: 舞蹈与其说是在体会当下，不如说是想要留住那一个瞬间。

translation: Even if the last second has passed.
transcript: 哪怕上一秒已经过去了。

translation: We can retain it the next second by constantly repeating the movement to achieve eternity.
transcript: 但下一秒，通过这个动作的重复，不断地去把那个过程本身累积下来达到永恒。

translation: That's all I want to share with you today.
transcript: 这是我今天想要说的一切。

translation: Thank you!
transcript: 谢谢!

translation: I want to invite dancer Huang Li to come on stage and say goodbye to everyone.
transcript: 邀请舞者黄丽上台与我跟大家做告别。

translation: I hope you will continue to pay attention to dance.
transcript: 请大家继续关注舞蹈。

translation: To the Tao Dance Theater and our nomadic plan.
transcript: 关注陶身体剧场，也关注我们的游牧计划。

translation: Thank you!
transcript: 谢谢!
